alert.note: Alert for Mercer; Monroe (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 21 at 10:45PM EDT until August 22 at 12:15AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM EDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of eastern Mercer and southwestern Monroe counties in southeast West Virginia, and parts of western Giles County in southwest Virginia. * WHEN...Until 100 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1044 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Dry Creek, Big Spring Branch, Brush Creek, East River, Daves Fork, Adair Run, Fivemile Creek, Beaver Branch, Bolars Fork and Crooked Creek. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pearisburg... Narrows... Peterstown... Rich Creek... Oakvale... Glen Lyn... Willowton... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
